column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking 1000mg of Niacin 2x a day for 8 years now. I started when I had a TRI level of over 600... with Niacin and some other changes it came down to about 200. I started taking Niacin under Dr.'s direction and found little effect at 500mg 2x a day... things improved dramatically when I went to the full 1000mg (2x/day). I do get blood tests for liver functions a couple of times a year. The hardest part of taking this is the "flushing effect," which can be uncomfortable. This effect is reduced when I take half an asprin with each dose (Dr.'s suggestion). It took a few months to adjust but the long term benefits (nonprescription intervention and cost) are well worth the results. Hang in there if you are going to try this and I would recommend doing so under a Dr.'s supervision. Good luck and I hope it works for you like it has for me!

column2: DanishViking, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My Dr. had me take niacin to reduce my cholesterol, I didn't get that much of a result in decrease.  Also I ended up with gout.  I now have to monitor the high amount of Uric Acid my blood to control the gout, because it now comes back. Watch your diet while taking niacin.
